name: Villanelle
description: Oxana Borisovna Vorontsova, from Perm. Professional assassin for the Twelve, codenamed Villanelle. Trained in Europe. Blonde, slender, with toned arms and a scar on her upper lip; she often wears her hair up. She is polyglot and has photographic memory, with expertise in fashion and haute cuisine. Her demeanour alternates between cold detachment and playful seductiveness. In social settings she is sophisticated and charming; in professional contexts, blunt and direct. Fluent in Russian, English, French and Italian with an academic background in Linguistics. Delivers cover stories flawlessly.

name: Konstantin
description: Former head of the Operations Department of Directorate S within the SVR (Russian foreign intelligence). Veteran of the Soviet-Afghan War, wounded at Khost in 1988 and decorated. Trained at the Andropov Academy, protégé of Yuri Modin, the KGB handler of the Cambridge spies. Appointed head of Directorate S before leaving the SVR in 2008. Known to Richard Edwards from their time in Kabul as cultured, charming, and ruthless. Serves as Villanelle's handler for the Twelve. Calm, methodical, and authoritative in demeanour, he employs a formal intelligence-officer register and addresses Villanelle by her patronymic, Oxana Borisovna.

name: Salvatore Greco
description: Sicilian Mafia boss, head of the Greci clan. Aged 55. Dedicated his life to resurrecting his family's influence after his father was murdered by the rival Matteo family in the 1990s. Has hunted down and killed all surviving Mattei. Personally responsible for at least 60 murders. Controls the Palermo drug trade, with enterprises worth an estimated $20-30 billion. Lives in a fortified farmhouse in a hill village outside Palermo. Wife: Calogera. Daughter: Valentina. Keeps a mistress in Palermo. Austere in tastes and pathologically averse to public attention.

name: Olivier
description: Young man in his mid-twenties, encountered at Le Jasmin club in Paris. Recently launched a career as an art dealer. Elegantly dishevelled with a languid posture and wry smile. Wry, confident, and flirtatious in manner, with a sophisticated upper-class French register.

name: Nica
description: Young woman in her mid-twenties, encountered at Le Jasmin club in Paris. Works intermittently as an actress. Cat-like and exquisite, with golden eyes and a cool, assessing manner. Direct and challenging in speech, favouring short declarative sentences, with a sophisticated upper-class French register.

name: Boris Vorontsov
description: Father of Villanelle/Oxana. Senior sergeant in the Russian Spetsnaz and close-combat instructor. Decorated veteran of Grozny and Pervomayskoye during the Chechen wars. When his wife Nadezhda was bedridden with illness, he cared for young Oxana, teaching her to fight and survive. Oxana's fondest memory of him involves going into the woods in winter, trapping a rabbit, and having her skin and cook it over a fire in the snow. Killed by the Brothers' Circle after a dispute with a gangster he worked for off the books.

name: Calogera Greco
description: Wife of Salvatore Greco. Rarely leaves the fortified farmhouse outside Palermo.

name: Valentina Greco
description: Daughter of Salvatore Greco. Lives in a neighbouring village, married to the eldest son of her father's consigliere.

name: Bruno De Santis
description: Journalist at Corriere della Sera. Wrote an article criticising Franca Farfaglia for accepting a donation from Salvatore Greco.

name: Franca Farfaglia
description: Young Sicilian soprano, 26 years old. Studies at La Scala Theatre Academy in Milan. Accepted a donation from Salvatore Greco. Commanding in appearance with proud, severe features. Scheduled to perform at Teatro Massimo in Palermo.

name: Miss Leonova
description: Anna Ivanovna Leonova, former French teacher at School No. 36 in Perm. Oxana was her most gifted pupil, though Leonova considered her emotionally destroyed inside. Around forty years old, with gentle, tired eyes. Wears a béret and carries the smell of cigarettes. Refined and literary in manner, with a formal register.

name: Frank
description: Former Special Boat Service (SBS) instructor, about 60 years old. Knotty and taciturn. Trains Oxana in fitness and unarmed combat. Wears a faded cotton tracksuit and old tennis shoes in all weathers. A merciless trainer who has refined elements of ju-jitsu, street-fighting, and other techniques into a single discipline. Gaze as cold as the North Sea. Terse, blunt, and profane, with few words, speaking in a working-class British military register. Teaches by physical example.

name: Fantine
description: Tiny, fierce-looking woman of about 60, dressed entirely in black. Lives in a first-floor apartment on the Quai Voltaire, Left Bank, Paris. Teaches Oxana Parisian style — fashion, hair, and scent — as a ruthlessly critical mentor. Responsible for Villanelle's transformation from Russian ex-convict to sophisticated Parisienne. Sharp, dismissive, and imperious in manner, using chérie as a patronising endearment. Speaks in an upper-class Parisian French register peppered with fashion terminology.

name: Leoluca Messina
description: Lean, dark-haired, about 35, with saturnine good looks. Nephew of Salvatore Greco and member of the Messini clan. Carries a Beretta Storm 9mm and rides a silver and black MV Agusta motorcycle. Confident, commanding, and flirtatious with an edge of threat. Direct in manner, speaking in a Sicilian Italian register typical of the upper-class criminal milieu.

name: Yiorgos Vlachos
description: Villanelle's first target. Was purchasing radioactive cobalt-60 in Eastern Europe with the intent to detonate a dirty bomb in Athens.

name: Dragan Horvat
description: Villanelle's second target. Balkan politician running a human trafficking network. Known to have become infatuated with a seventeen-year-old heroin-addicted girl from Tbilisi.

name: Yuliana
description: Psychotherapist at the University of Perm. Had a relationship with Oxana during Oxana's first year as an undergraduate, which left her bereft and with her personal and professional self-esteem in tatters after Oxana lost interest.

name: Paolo Vella
description: Agent of the Polizia di Stato based in Palermo. Casual and warm in manner, with an informal Sicilian police register. Speaks Italian and Sicilian.

name: Eve Polastri
description: Former MI5 analyst. Dark-haired and slender, she wears glasses and has little interest in dressing well, favouring practicality over style. Direct, analytical, and self-deprecating, with a tendency to swear when passionate. Employs a professional intelligence register at work and is more informal at home. Native English speaker who can read Russian.

name: Niko Polastri
description: Eve's husband, around 38-39 years old. Tall, with patient brown eyes and a cavalry officer moustache. Maths teacher and bridge instructor at the West Hampstead club. Holds a master's degree from Cracow University, where he toured Europe winning tournaments with his friend Maciek. Hobbies include beekeeping and gadgets. Gentle, patient, and humorous, with an educated yet eccentric warmth. Polish native speaker who peppers his speech with Polish words, using myszka and Evochka as endearments for Eve.

name: Simon Mortimer
description: Eve's deputy at P3 in Thames House. In his twenties, with the arch solemnity of a metropolitan vicar. Formal, precise, and diplomatically tactful, with a civil service register.

name: Viktor Kedrin
description: Russian political theorist from St Petersburg State University. Broad, bearded, and charismatic. Advocates anti-American, pro-Eurasian superstate ideology. Oratorical, passionate, and poetic in manner, frequently quoting Akhmatova. Speaks as a charismatic academic public speaker in both Russian and English.

name: Anne-Laure Mercier
description: Villanelle's closest friend in Paris. Pretty, extroverted, and lonely. Former public relations professional, married to Gilles Mercier of the French Treasury. Sexually reckless. Lives on Avenue Kléber. Effusive, gossipy, and affectionate in manner, fond of endearments. Speaks in an upper-class Parisian social register.

name: Gilles Mercier
description: Senior functionary at the French Treasury. More than sixteen years older than his wife Anne-Laure. Passions include his wine cellar and ormolu clocks. Lives on Avenue Kléber, Paris.

name: Bill Tregaron
description: Eve's former head of section at P3. His career ended after the Horvat assassination occurred on his watch. Subsequently seconded to GCHQ in Cheltenham.

name: DCI Gary Hurst
description: Detective Chief Inspector with the Metropolitan Police. Assigned as senior investigating officer to the Kedrin case at the Vernon Hotel. Professional with dry humour and a direct manner, speaking in a police procedural register.

name: Richard Edwards
description: Former MI6 station chief in Moscow, later head of the Russia desk. Operates from a cover office at BQ Optics above Goodge Street. Recruits Eve for a classified operation. Known to have a personal acquaintance with Konstantin Orlov. Wife: Amanda, an artist. Daughter: Chloe, an aspiring actress. Formal, authoritative, and clipped in manner, with a senior intelligence register.

name: Lucy Drake
description: Model and aspiring actress with vivid emerald green eyes. Lives in Queen's Park.

name: Sarah
description: Gallery owner in Mayfair. In her late thirties, with a wheat-blonde chignon. Speaks in a London art-world register.

name: Luis Martin
description: Spanish. Owns Tempest modelling agency with his wife Elvira, with divisions in Paris, London, Milan, and Moscow. Flirtatious and narcissistic.

name: Irema Beridze
description: Horvat's seventeen-year-old Georgian girlfriend. Heroin addict from Tbilisi.

name: Vitaly Chuvarov
description: Political associate of Viktor Kedrin with crime connections. Distinguished by his ponytail.

name: Gerald Watts
description: Reception manager at the Vernon Hotel. Has worked at the front desk for five years.

name: Zhang Lei
description: Chinese PLA officer heading the White Dragon cyber-warfare crew. Pudgy and bespectacled, operates from the Pudong district in Shanghai.

name: Alice Mao
description: Owner of the Aquarium nightclub in the Shanghai French Concession. Attractive and short-haired.

name: Jin Qiang
description: MSS (Ministry of State Security) officer. Cultured, charming, and steely. Loves Hunan food, early Chinese cinema, and post-punk music such as Gang of Four. A superb dancer. Formal and cultured in manner, with wry humour.

name: Janie Chou
description: Transgender woman working for Konstantin in Shanghai. Beautiful, dark-haired, with a dimpled grin. Bubbly and informal in manner, speaking in broken English.

name: Nurse Wu
description: Nurse at a fetish establishment on Dangfeng Road in Pudong.

name: Roman Nikonov
description: Former student at School No. 36 in Perm. At eighteen, he sexually assaulted Anna Leonova while she waited for a late-night bus home from school. Arrested but released on a technicality after police mishandled the forensic evidence. Castrated by young Oxana in the woods by the Mulyanka river. Survived the attack.

name: Mikki Nakamura
description: Patron of the Aquarium club in Shanghai, part of Alice Mao's social circle.

name: Howard
description: Man at the Aquarium club in Shanghai, part of Alice Mao's social circle.

name: Calum Dennis
description: Station armourer at Dever Research Station in Hampshire. Trains Eve in firearms handling, particularly the Glock 19.

name: Lance Pope
description: Career MI6 officer and veteran of overseas postings. Experienced agent runner and skilled housebreaker. Chronic online gambler, divorced, living alone in Croydon. Lean, with suspicious features. Dry, laconic, and sardonic in manner, with an informal register. Joins Eve's team.

name: Billy Primrose
description: Former teenage hacker (handle $qeeky), recruited by the MI6 Security Exploitation team. Asthmatic, with black-dyed hair and a pale complexion. Technical genius. Casual, geeky, and irreverent in manner, with an informal register. Joins Eve's team.

name: Dennis Cradle
description: Director of D4 Branch at MI5, responsible for counter-espionage against Russia and China. Tanned, bullish, about fifty. Lives in Muswell Hill.

name: Penny Cradle
description: Dennis Cradle's wife. Corporate lawyer based at Canary Wharf. Prettyish, well-groomed, about 45.

name: Tony Kent
description: Low-profile venture capitalist. Member of an exclusive fly-fishing syndicate on the River Itchen.

name: Zbigniew
description: Niko's Polish friend and a classics scholar. Bear-like in build.

name: Claudia
description: Zbig's girlfriend, an educational psychologist. Glacial in demeanour.

name: Anton
description: Villanelle's handler after Konstantin. Dark, cold eyes and an unkempt beard. Former commander of E Squadron, MI6's black operations unit. Controls Villanelle on behalf of the Twelve. Commanding, cold, and pragmatic in manner, with a formal register.

name: Lara Farmanyants
description: Full name Larissa Farmanyants. Former partner and accomplice of Villanelle/Oxana. Released from Butyrka prison and later serves as a sniper for the Twelve. Uses they/them pronouns. Direct and military in manner, with a formal register.

name: Rinat Yevtukh
description: Head of Zoloty Bratstvo (Golden Brotherhood) mafia gang based in Odessa. Owns a fortified villa in Fontanka.

name: Kim
description: Franco-Vietnamese dancer at the Paris Opera Ballet, 23 years old. Lean, with refined features and ivory skin.

name: Gabriela Vukovic
description: Dennis Cradle's twenty-eight-year-old mistress. Works at the fitness club and spa at the Hotel du Littoral. Owns a yacht called Babydoll and an apartment at Les Asphodèles in Cap d'Antibes.

name: Katya Goraya
description: Rinat Yevtukh's twenty-five-year-old lingerie model girlfriend. Demanding and materialistic.

name: Sergei (Cradle recruiter)
description: Young Russian, about 30. Wears Brioni suits, speaks flawless English and perfect French. Polished, cultured, and persuasive in manner, with a formal register. Operates as a recruiter for the Twelve.

name: Rem Bakker
description: Poses as a Dutch IT consultant from Delft, with a wife named Gaite. Cover identity for a Twelve recruiter.

name: Max Linder
description: Franco-Dutch far-right political activist and media celebrity. Twenty-nine years old, gay. Has a huge following among young Europeans and the appearance of a pop star. Believes the obese should be placed in labour camps and sex offenders guillotined. His association with Nazism makes him problematic for the Twelve.

name: Abby
description: Eve's contact at the Metropolitan Police Forensic Laboratory in Lambeth. Professional and friendly in manner, with an informal register.

name: Mark
description: Eve and Niko's new neighbour. Compliance manager at a City bank. Wears strawberry-coloured trousers and a Guernsey sweater. Socially awkward and insensitive. Pompous and gauche in manner, with an informal register.

name: Fiona
description: Mark's wife. Works in political public relations for the MP Gareth Wolf. Wears an enviable black Whistles coat. Forced smile. Defensive and curt in manner, with an informal register.

name: Leila
description: Zbigniew's girlfriend of several years. Spirited and direct. Witty and practical in manner, with an informal register.

name: Marta
description: Caretaker of Villanelle's building in Paris, living on the fifth floor. Keeps several kittens. Fond of the young tenant on the sixth floor.

name: Anne-Laure
description: Acquaintance of Villanelle in Paris. Believes Villanelle lives in Versailles and works as a currency trader.

name: Gareth Wolf
description: British MP for whom Fiona works in public relations. Known for expenses scandals and morally questionable behaviour.

name: Armando Trevisan
description: Questore (police chief) of Venice, based at the questura in Santa Croce. Thin, in a dark suit, with economical movements and an attentive air. Has an English mother and spent childhood summers in Tunbridge Wells. Speaks perfect English. Precise, formal yet cordial, and witty in manner.

name: Giovanna Bianchi
description: Director of the Van Diest boutique in Venice on Calle Vallaresso. Expert in perfumes, with a mother who worked in a perfumery. Elegant, direct, and curious in manner, moving between formal and informal registers.

name: Claudio Forlani
description: Son of the owner of Palazzo Forlani in Venice. Dark-haired, with aquiline features, a broken nose, and a sensual mouth. Charming and cultivated. Cultured, seductive, and ironic in manner, with an informal register.

name: Umberto Zeni
description: Venetian jewellery designer. Diminutive, dressed entirely in leather fetish wear. His collection installation features a crashed Alfa Romeo with celebrities adorned with jewellery in place of injuries.

name: Bianca
description: Shop assistant at the Van Diest boutique in Venice. Speaks Russian and typically serves Russian-speaking clients.

name: Magali Le Meur
description: Leader of the French Nouvelle Droite party, advocate of pan-European nationalism. Broad, rough features with beautiful eyes but a thin, intolerant mouth. Wears a thousand-euro Moncler coat and a diamond Cartier watch.

name: Todd Stanton
description: Former CIA psy-ops officer, expert in the collection and manipulation of personal data online. Regarded as the dark cardinal of the American right. Heavyset, with a florid complexion and a wolf-skin coat. Coarse, direct, and peppered with Americanisms, with an informal register.

name: Leonardo Venturi
description: Italian political theorist and founder of Lapsit Exillis, a self-styled initiatic guild for aristocrats of the spirit. Tiny, with wild hair and a monocle. Pontificates on the knights of the Grail. Pompous and philosophical in manner, with a formal register.

name: Inka Järvi
description: Finnish leader of the Daughters of Odin. Statuesque.

name: Richard Baggot
description: Leader of the UK Patriots Party. Paunchy, with a crocodile smile and a loud tweed suit. Harasses waitresses and makes sexist jokes. Coarse, arrogant, and vulgar in manner, with an informal register.

name: Silas Orr-Hadow
description: Upper-caste Tory whose family has supplied several generations of fascist sympathisers to England. Pencil-thin. Wears lederhosen and white knee socks at the Felsnadel.

name: Petra Voss
description: Lead singer of Panzerdämmerung, a dark band on the far-right circuit. Imperious and feline, with a severe dark haircut. Lesbian. Plays a red Fender Stratocaster.

name: Klaus Lorenz
description: Bassist of Panzerdämmerung, one of the two Lorenz brothers. Handsome, in a black uniform with a military cut.

name: Peter Lorenz
description: Drummer of Panzerdämmerung, brother of Klaus. Maintains a driving backbeat that builds to a devastating crescendo.

name: Johanna
description: Temporary worker from an Innsbruck agency at the Felsnadel. Close-set eyes, freckles, and a full figure in a pink quilted jacket. Feigns friendliness but reports everything to Birgit. Chatty and gossipy, with an informal register.

name: Birgit
description: Manager employed by Max Linder at the Felsnadel. Severely dressed, in her forties. Obsessively controls the staff with fetishistically precise rules on hairstyles, make-up, and perfume. Rumoured to have whipped a girl for wearing mascara. Authoritarian, brusque, and controlling in manner, with a formal register.

name: Maria (Felsnadel)
description: Villanelle's Polish roommate at the Felsnadel. Pale and young, wearing a tracksuit and woollen cap. Tired and resigned but supportive in manner, with an informal register.

name: Sim Henderson
description: Russian-speaking investigator in the Economic Crimes department of the City of London Police.

name: Oleg
description: Russian contact sent by Richard Edwards to arrange logistics for Eve. In his late thirties, with skin that has not seen sunlight in months and a blank expression. Handles visas and logistics. Speaks basic English, direct in manner, with an informal register.

name: Yuri Modin
description: Historical figure. Former KGB handler of the Cambridge spies (Philby, Burgess, Maclean, Blunt). Guest lecturer at the Andropov Academy, where he taught the Active Measures course covering subversion, disinformation, and assassination. Konstantin Orlov was his protégé.

name: Vadim Tikhomirov
description: Former FSB officer who becomes President of Russia. Cultured and witty, alternating between dark humour and a diplomatic tone. Mixes pop-culture references with geopolitical reflections. Speaks in an ironic, sophisticated manner with a formal register.

name: Amanda Edwards
description: Wife of Richard Edwards. Artist working in watercolours and drawings — landscapes of the Cotswolds, boats at Aldeburgh, and a portrait of Richard. A refined woman with pale sea-glass eyes and fine bones. Exhibits at a gallery in Chiswick overlooking the Thames. Composed and slightly acerbic in tone, with subtle irony and an air of class assurance. Speaks in a formal register.

name: Chloe Edwards
description: Daughter of Richard and Amanda Edwards. Long-lashed eyes and her mother's bone structure. Aspiring actress keen to attend drama school. Exuberant and friendly. As a girl, became infatuated with a Russian acquaintance of her father's. Youthful and enthusiastic in manner, with direct, colloquial language and an informal register.

name: Colin Dye
description: Shop assistant at Whitlock and Jones medical supplies on Welbeck Street, London. Fond of making puns on his surname. Informal in manner.

name: Igor
description: Russian sailor on the container ship Kirovo-Chepetsk. Has an aunt named Galya who drives a tram in Smolensk. Speaks in a colloquial register.

name: Dasha Kvariani
description: Alias Necksnapper. Former cellmate of Oxana at Dobryanka prison. Speaks fluent Russian and rudimentary English, with intentional grammatical errors that characterise her speech. Direct and menacing in manner, with a colloquial register.

name: Kristina
description: Dasha Kvariani's partner. Known as Kris. Kind, perceptive, and discreet. Lives with Dasha in an apartment in Avtovo. Her room is decorated with posters of Amazonian women riding dinosaurs, velvet unicorns, Beanie Babies, and Marvel heroine figurines. Loves the Soviet cartoon Hedgehog in the Fog. Fears the vorovskoy mir and dreams of a quiet life with Dasha in Karelia, counting the stars. Rarely speaks and does so very quietly, but when she does she is direct and surprisingly astute. Native Russian speaker with a formal register.

name: Asmat Dzabrati
description: Pakhan (supreme boss) of the Kupchino Bratva in St Petersburg, a gang controlling the heroin trade. Sixty-nine years old. Lives in a seventeen-storey building on Malaya Balkanskaya Ulitsa, near Kupchino metro station, where he owns several apartments occupied by bodyguards, his ex-wife Yelena, and his sister Rushana with her husband. Keeps a twenty-four-year-old Ukrainian sugar baby named Zoya in a separate apartment. Frequents the Elizarova banya in Proletarskaya, the Ossetian restaurant Zarina, and a clinic on Nevsky Prospekt. Suffers from atrial fibrillation and takes Digoxin. Prison tattoos: a knife on the neck, eight-pointed stars on the collarbones, and epaulettes on the shoulders. Has killed several people with an axe. Expert in counter-surveillance, with appointments set at the last minute, decoy cars, and variable routes.

name: Angelina
description: Wife of Pavel, one of Dasha's boyevik (soldiers). Nervous eyes and burnt-caramel hair. Materialistic and superficial, typical of the bratva women. Decorates her décolletage with small golden stars. Direct and pragmatic, with interests limited to clothes, children, and unfaithful husbands. Speaks in a colloquial register.

name: Pavel
description: Husband of Angelina. Boyevik (soldier) in Dasha Kvariani's brigade.

name: Gennadi Kvariani
description: Father of Dasha Kvariani. Former head of a Kupchino Bratva brigade that controlled the heroin trade in St Petersburg. So powerful that local prosecutors did not dare try Dasha locally. Retired, having passed leadership of the brigade to his daughter.

name: Yelena
description: Ex-wife of the Pakhan Asmat Dzabrati. Lives in one of the apartments in the building on Malaya Balkanskaya Ulitsa, near Kupchino metro station. Disapproves of the Pakhan's relationship with Zoya.

name: Rushana
description: Sister of the Pakhan Asmat Dzabrati. Lives with her husband in the building on Malaya Balkanskaya Ulitsa. Acts as hostess when the Pakhan receives bratva members and their families. Disapproves of her brother's relationship with Zoya.

name: Zoya
description: Twenty-four-year-old Ukrainian woman, the Pakhan Asmat Dzabrati's sugar baby. Met him through a dating agency. Lives in a small apartment behind the Fruzensky department store in St Petersburg, paid for by the Pakhan. Receives a generous monthly allowance. Gets Botox injections at a clinic on Nevsky Prospekt. The Pakhan's family and ex-wife Yelena refuse to acknowledge her, so she never visits the building on Malaya Balkanskaya.

name: Nadezhda Vorontsova
description: Mother of Villanelle/Oxana. Raised on a farm near Novozybkov; her family was originally from Chuvashia. Very beautiful in the Chuvash manner, with a high forehead, long dark hair, and an expression of surprise given by the arch of her eyebrows. At fifteen, the Chernobyl disaster (150 km away) contaminated the Novozybkov area; her village was evacuated and became a Closed Zone. She moved to Perm, married Boris Vorontsov at twenty-two, and Oxana was born a year later. Suffered from an illness, probably radiation-related, spending entire days in bed. Took young Oxana to the Kungur ice caves as a special outing. Died a few weeks later.

name: Dima
description: Assistant to Vadim Tikhomirov (FSB). Young, good-looking man in winter camouflage uniform.

name: Nobby
description: Former sniper section leader in E Squadron (MI6 black operations). Now an instructor and watchdog at Knock Tom. Trains Villanelle/Oxana and Anton. Tells anecdotes about women from the clubs on Brentwood High Street. Prepares meals in the platform canteen. Informal and comradely in manner, with barrack-room humour. Speaks with a British accent and military slang.

name: Ginge
description: Former sniper section leader in E Squadron. Stocky, bald Welshman with a mischievous twinkling smile. Instructor at Knock Tom for Charlie and Eve. Expert in ballistics — range, wind, drag, spin-drift, and the Coriolis effect. Pragmatic and witty. Informal and cheerful in manner, mixing Welsh-accented military slang with good-natured banter.

name: Valery Stechkin
description: President of the Russian Federation.

name: Ronald Loy
description: President of the United States of America.

name: Inna Lapotnikova
description: Customs officer at Sheremetyevo Airport in Moscow. An elderly woman with tiny granite eyes. Formal in manner.

name: Tolya
description: Paramilitary operative of the Twelve. Young man with a hard face, carrying a submachine gun slung over his leather jacket. Does not speak.

name: Gennadi
description: Former KGB agent, one of the last kroty (moles) with knowledge of the underground tunnel network beneath Moscow. An elderly man in a creased coat with a miner's helmet fitted with a headlamp. Has seen skeletons dating back to the Stalin era. Dry and sardonic in manner, with an informal register.

name: Alexei
description: Plainclothes FSB officer. Divorced, with a girlfriend named Vika, a librarian at MSU, and a dog named Archie. Great enthusiast of classical music, particularly Rachmaninoff. Veteran of the Dubrovka Theatre siege, his first experience of action. Spare, competent, and culturally refined in manner. Speaks little but with authority, with a formal register.

name: Max
description: MI6 agent operating undercover as a representative of the Twelve. Lean, dark, about 30, with non-native Russian. Direct and self-assured, diplomatic with subtle authority. Speaks in a formal register.

name: Balice St Clair
description: Head of the Russia desk at MI6. Secretly attracted to women. Married to Charlie St Clair (MI5) for career convenience. Habitually unfaithful and manipulative. Speaks few words, whispered, with an intense and magnetic presence. Formal in register.

name: Nastya
description: Linguistics lecturer at St Petersburg University. Young, attractive academic, married to a city duma deputy.

name: Ron Tiberius
description: American billionaire and paedophile. Owns the villa Les Pivoines on the Côte d'Azur. Known personally to Balice. Target of both the Twelve and MI6.

name: Myrtha Willis
description: Former media intern for the British Conservative Party. Had a relationship with Tiberius and now serves as his official companion and procurer of young girls. Known at Downing Street by the nickname Sharky the Beaver. Secondary target of the Twelve.

name: Adam Fentiman
description: British politician, likely future Foreign Secretary. Oxford contemporary of the future Prime Minister. Compromised by a photograph with a minor on Tiberius's yacht at La Napoule. A puppet of Tiberius.

name: Lev Leonov
description: Young Russian oligarch, owner of the Apokalipsis club on the Griboyedov Canal in St Petersburg.

name: Sergei
description: Member of the Twelve and close associate of Nikolai Dominik. Round spectacles, prematurely grey hair, and a vaguely intellectual air. Quiet and cultivated, using historical references as conversational cover. Speaks in a formal register.

name: Kira
description: Young woman in a tailored grey suit. Formal in manner.

name: Darren
description: Young, nervous, and thin MI6 officer who manages the safe house on Ventnor Road in North Finchley. Apologises constantly, offers instant coffee and soya milk, and asks for expense receipts. Shy, apologetic, and embarrassed in manner, with an informal register.

name: Pippa
description: Leader of the Ossa and Pelion tour. About 50, with an uneven blonde bob and a silk scarf at her neck. Efficient and always composed. Carries documents and a laminated name badge.

name: Johnny Fernandes
description: Agent of the Twelve assigned as Villanelle's handler during the tour. Cover identity: retired Anglo-Asian widower with a passion for roses. In reality a veteran of the profession of arms. Knows Sergei from St Petersburg and knew Konstantin. Has a grip of steel.

name: Ingo Vance
description: Member of the tour. Stage actor, theatrical in manner, who tells backstage anecdotes. Husband of Teazel.

name: Teazel Vance
description: Member of the tour. Former television star of the 1970s series The Gumdrops, in which she played Milly Mauve, the singer. Elfin features, diminutive, wrapped in layers of pashmina. Wife of Ingo.

name: William Mortishead
description: Member of the tour. Historian writing a book on the young Pitt. Distinguished but unkempt, with a mild blue gaze. Husband of Lorna.

name: Lorna Mortishead
description: Member of the tour. Freelance editor, semi-retired. In her sixties, with glossy brown hair and protruding cocker-spaniel eyes. Wife of William.

name: Dan Melbury
description: Member of the tour. Television celebrity and presenter of Topsoil on Channel 4. Expert gardening lecturer.

name: Lorelei Vane-Muir
description: Member of the tour. Dramatic and loud woman, acquainted with William Mortishead. Orders gin and tonic at seven in the morning in first class. Dismissive of her fellow travellers.

name: Sylvie
description: Pornographic actress from Nice, 24 years old but looks 16. Specialises in barely-legal roles. Recruited by MI6 by leveraging her tax evasion.

name: Comtesse de Quincy
description: Owner of the Pavillon du Rossignol in Provence. Slender, with silver hair, wearing dungarees and tennis shoes. Her garden serves as a memorial to her late husband.

name: Anna Volkonskaya
description: Opposition candidate in the Russian presidential election. Nationalist-traditionalist platform. Backed by the Orthodox Church. Seen as a champion of old values: duty, honour, and religious observance. A direct threat to Tikhomirov.

name: Valentin Dominik
description: Secret descendant of the Romanovs. His great-grandmother, Alexandra Nikolaevna, was the secret daughter of Nicholas II, smuggled to France by Philippe de Lyon in 1903. Has haemophilia B (the same form as Alexei Romanov), inherited through the maternal line. Raised in poverty in Marseille by a single mother, in and out of hospitals. Sergei found him at the age of twelve. Nikolai informally adopted him, providing for his health and education. His mother died ten years ago and he moved to the Dominik Mansion. Calls himself kukushka (cuckoo). Dreams of painting wild birds.

name: Nikolai Dominik
description: Russian oligarch and father of Valentin. Ordinary-looking but commanding. Hard, tight smile, watchful eyes, hair combed back. Handshake strong enough to cause pain. His intimidating presence diminishes Valentin.

name: Uttara Khedkar
description: Daughter of a Bollywood film producer. Student at a cookery school in South Kensington. Stopped outside a Park Lane nightclub with 24 doses of cocaine. Blackmailed by Balice into serving as a waitress-spy at the Indian Military and Sporting Club in exchange for avoiding prison.

name: Anastasia Dominik
description: Wife of Nikolai Dominik and mother of Valentin. Voluminous honey-blonde hair, cosmetically smoothed skin, and sulky, spoilt features like a Persian cat. Stoic and magnificent in crises. Formal in manner.

name: Charlie St Clair
description: Husband of Balice St Clair. Fast-track MI5 officer, now head of technical and surveillance operations, including the elite A4 watchers team. Inter-service marriage with Balice, one of convenience for both. Not a brilliant mind but entertaining. Probably having an affair with his assistant Dawn. Fond of lingerie. Informal and direct in manner, with a middle-upper colloquial register typical of an MI5 officer.

name: Dawn
description: Personal assistant to Charlie St Clair at MI5. Probably having an affair with Charlie.

name: Bilyana Ilieva
description: Bulgarian judoka from the Targovishte Tigers. In reality an agent of Johnny Fernandes and the Twelve. Physically athletic. Speaks non-native English with characteristic grammatical errors, interspersed with Bulgarian and Russian words. Direct and unintentionally comic in manner, with a low colloquial register.

name: Cecil Phipps
description: Deputy to Balice St Clair on the MI6 Russia desk. Described as odious and unctuous.

name: Dimitri
description: Russian security guard at the Dominik Mansion. Works alongside Pavel, another guard.

name: Nate Paget
description: School friend of Valentin. Tall, slender, paler than Valentin, with dark, ironic eyes. Wears a white silk shirt with a German Iron Cross on a black moiré ribbon. Celebrates his birthday at a Mayfair club. Distributes Gonzadril pills to guests. Aspires to enter politics.

name: Larissa
description: Maid at the Dominik Mansion. Brings trays of coffee to the guest rooms.

name: Philippe de Lyon
description: Mysterious French historical figure. Arrived in St Petersburg in 1901, destitute, after the birth of Nicholas II's fourth daughter (Anastasia). Promised Tsarina Alexandra a male heir — she miscarried, and Philippe returned to France exceedingly wealthy. Alexei was not born until 1904. His portrait hangs in both the Dominik Mansion and a major Russian art gallery.

name: Denis Borzhko
description: Senior GRU (Russian military intelligence) officer. Dark hair and rough stubble.

name: Gyorgiy Peskov
description: Senior GRU officer. Blond with a heavy build.

name: Alexandra Nikolaevna
description: Secret daughter of Tsar Nicholas II and Tsarina Alexandra of Russia, born in 1903. Officially the pregnancy was declared a miscarriage. Philippe de Lyon smuggled her out of Russia as a newborn. She grew up in Avignon with a childless couple. Married, had a daughter, and that daughter had Valentin. Biological great-grandmother of Valentin Dominik.

name: Indrani Sen
description: Intensive care specialist at St Mary's Hospital in Paddington. Professional and efficient, with brisk, economical movements. Clinical but not cold in tone, with a formal register.

name: Irene Mendoza
description: Filipino staff nurse at St Mary's Hospital. Professional and caring. Wears Crocs. Courteous, using the nursing we in a formal register.

name: Vyacheslav Golovkin
description: Press secretary to Anna Volkonskaya, the Russian presidential candidate. Formal and controlled, nearing the end of his patience. Favours short, imperative sentences. Speaks in a formal register.

name: Dido
description: Niko Polastri's new partner. Red-haired, works in public relations. Has a golden retriever named Haribo. Nervous and easily embarrassed, polite and friendly in manner, with an informal register.

name: Farad Ismailov
description: Wealthy young man, son of a rich patriarch. Educated at Trinity College, Oxford, and Sandhurst. Compulsive gambler, owing approximately £250,000 to the Caspian's casino. Feels an outsider in British high society despite his wealth. Drives an ice-blue Bentley. Of Afghan/Persian origin. Controlled and polite in tone but with repressed anger. Scrupulously courteous with those he despises. Speaks in a formal register.

name: Shirin Ismailova
description: Sister of Farad Ismailov. A slender young woman. Uses padar (Dari for father) to address her father. Caring and reassuring. Formal in manner.

name: Majid Ismailov
description: Patriarch of the Ismailov family. Metals magnate and owner of the Buxor mining company. Billionaire, 65 years old. The most powerful man in Naziristan (a fictional Central Asian country). Passionate about horse racing — owns more than twenty thoroughbreds at Newmarket, trained by Josh Riordan. Dreams of winning the Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe with Beulah Boy. Former wife Gulnara died of leukaemia. Accompanied by Naziristani bodyguards. Formal in manner.

name: Mimi Stackridge
description: Pale, thin woman of indeterminate age. Wears an ivory satin dress. Speaks with a degraded private-school English accent. Uses cocaine. Flat, detached, and brutally direct in manner, with an informal register.

name: Crispin Vale
description: Co-owner of the Caspian's casino alongside Nate Paget.

name: Adam Shaw
description: MI6 officer. Hair combed back, with subtly superior manners. Raised in the country, well acquainted with the world of horses and racing. Professional and slightly condescending, employing British understatement. Speaks in a formal register.

name: Davy McPhee
description: Stable lad who works with Budoor and Sofinisba at Josh Riordan's yard.

name: Josh Riordan
description: Racehorse trainer based near Newmarket at Great Ditton. Manages four lots of horses each morning from six to twelve.

name: Joe
description: Lead jockey at Josh Riordan's yard. Will ride Beulah Boy in the Arc de Triomphe. Lean and cheerful, wearing a riding cap and waterproof. Laconic, with few words and an informal register.

name: Oliver Reynolds
description: School friend of Farad who inherited his father's training yard near Bury St Edmunds. His father Rory Reynolds was a famous National Hunt jockey who won the Grand National on The Bizzler before becoming a successful trainer. Rory died suddenly a couple of years earlier of a heart condition. Ollie is a heavy drinker, and the yard is probably in decline since his father's time.

name: Sir Gavin Rycart
description: Commissioner of the Metropolitan Police of London. Formal in manner.

name: Marcus Hunt
description: Undercover police officer with a significant history of alleged sexual offences that somehow evaded vetting checks. His case prompted concerns about a potential scandal within the Metropolitan Police.

name: Wayne
description: Corrupt police officer and colleague of Marcus Hunt. Massive build, round reddish head, and ginger hair. Carries a taser and a Glock. Vulgar, sexist, and intimidating in manner, with a colloquial register.

name: Azim
description: Young Naziristani bodyguard in the service of Majid Ismailov at Great Ditton. Barely past adolescence, with a soft curly beard. Speaks Russian better than English. The son and grandson of fighters.

name: Zafar
description: Young Naziristani bodyguard in the service of Majid Ismailov at Great Ditton. Barely past adolescence, with a soft curly beard. Speaks Russian better than English. The son and grandson of fighters.

name: Rustam Dzhuraev
description: Naziristani revolutionary, born to a Naziristani mother and a Russian father who served in Spetsnaz. Also known as PALANG (the Tiger) and Viktor Batyrshin. Runs the Café Bulbul in Pakhtun and leads environmental protests against Buxor in Naziristan. A childhood friend of Farad Ismailov. Educated and fluent in Russian and English.

name: Pete
description: Farrier who works at Josh Riordan's yard. Large and sturdy, with calloused dirty hands and a leather apron. His girlfriend Errin works for Oliver Reynolds.

name: Errin
description: Pete's girlfriend, working as a stable lad at Oliver Reynolds's yard.

name: Captain Gladstone
description: British Army captain responsible for the MI6 base at Dever in Hampshire. Tall, bespectacled, with a dry sense of humour. A skilled chess player.

name: Philippe Devereaux
description: French owner of Prince d'Aquitaine, a favourite for the Arc de Triomphe. In his late forties, with sardonic good looks. Wears Eau Sauvage. Extremely self-assured. His horse is based at Chantilly.

name: Shiki Goto
description: Japanese owner of Kintarou, a horse running in the Arc de Triomphe. Scrupulously polite and an enthusiast of Sailor Moon.
